Backend

Class SilkBag

  • java.lang.Object
    • Backend.SilkBag

  • public class SilkBag
extends java.lang.Object
    The Silk Bag class is responsible for holding tiles not on the board or in the Player's hand.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mart Krol

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.LinkedList<Tile> tiles

      void addTile(FloorTile tile)
      The method addTile is responsible for adding the tiles that are 'pushed' off the board back into the SilkBag.

      The method drawTile is responsible for allowing the player to draw a random tile from the SilkBag.

        public SilkBag()
        Default constructor for SilkBag.

    • Method Detail

      • fillBag

        public void fillBag(int noFloorTiles,
                    int noActionTiles)
        The method fillBag is responsible for filling the LinkedList that is SilkBag.
        Parameters:
        noFloorTiles - An integer representing the number of FloorTiles that will be generated in the SilkBag.
        noActionTiles - An integer representing the number of ActionTiles that will be generated in the SilkBag.

      • addTile

        public void addTile(FloorTile tile)
        The method addTile is responsible for adding the tiles that are 'pushed' off the board back into the SilkBag.
        Parameters:
        tile - Floor tile.

      • drawTile

        public Tile drawTile()
        The method drawTile is responsible for allowing the player to draw a random tile from the SilkBag.
        Returns:
        A random tile, being either a FloorTile or ActionTile

      • generateFloorTiles

        private void generateFloorTiles(java.lang.String tileType,
                                int orientationNo)
        The method GenerateFloorTiles is responsible for constructing FloorTiles.
        Parameters:
        tileType - A string referring to the type of FloorTile it will construct.
        orientationNo - An integer between 0-3 specifying the orientation of the FloorTile.

      • generateActionTiles

        private void generateActionTiles(java.lang.String tileType)
        The method GenerateActionTiles is responsible for constructing ActionTiles.
        Parameters:
        tileType - A string referring to the type of ActionTile it will construct.
